website_summaries.verdict: An 18-inch nonstick rolling pin for better baking results.
pros: Bakers love the nonstick aspect, especially when it comes to rolling out delicate crusts and pastries
The wooden pin is covered with a black metal exterior
cons: The metal could rust if not properly cared for

customer_reviews.title: Does What It Says
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this rolling pin. I've only used it once so far, but I used it to roll out yeast dough for cinnamon rolls, and it didn't stick. It is lightweight, and easy to clean. The best part was that it only cost $4 for a nonstick rolling pin! I actually bought a second one for my mother since they were so cheap. I'd say that based on price and performance, this is an overall great value.
customer_reviews.author: sec682

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent choice in rolling pins. Totally non-stick and super easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: MyPenNameTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Wooden handles break when pushed hard
customer_reviews.text: Non-stick surface is ok, but don't push on handles too hard or they break. Metal rod inside the pin does not go all the way to the end or even the middle of the wooden handle. As a result when pushed hard on the handle it might crack and fall off the rod.
customer_reviews.author: Anatolii Corobceanu

customer_reviews.title: Best rolling pin ever!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't bother to disassemble it to uncover hidden secrets, but I can tell you that at 18" and totally non-stick, this rolling pin is perfect for pastry. I used to cover my wooden rolling pin with Saran Wrap, which helped a little, but this is so much easier. Highly recommend it for bakers.
customer_reviews.author: dweezil

customer_reviews.title: Rolling pin
customer_reviews.text: This rolling pin has been a delight. I replaced an old wooden one of many years and found I didn't have to use as much flour as before when rolling a crust or cookie dough. I will recommend this to a lot of people.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Works far better than the traditional wooden one!
customer_reviews.text: I've always hated rolling out anything with my old, wooden rolling pin. Thankfully I purchased this one and have found my baking bliss once more! I purchased it for $4.95...it's perfect and you should'nt hesitiate to feel confident in purchasing one.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Polk

customer_reviews.title: I Wouldn't Say it's Completely Non-Stick
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rolling pin and although the description states non-stick, that's not entirely true. Of course it's more non-stick than other rolling pins, but this rolling pin definitely stuck quite a bit to my sugar cookie dough despite all the flour I used. All in all it was still a good purchase, just not completely non-stick.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful rolling pin
customer_reviews.text: This rolling pin is exactly as it says. It's non-stick and easy clean-up. It is heavy and of good quality. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cook

customer_reviews.title: so easy
customer_reviews.text: This is so much easier to wash then my wooden rolling pin. It spreads the dough nicely too.
customer_reviews.author: Dori Herndon

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love it , if you're the type of person that works with dough a lot you'll love it too
customer_reviews.author: youstina

customer_reviews.title: blah
customer_reviews.text: I guess I will be investing in the wooden rolling pin after all, non-stick doesnt always mean non-stick.. Hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: R. Ratcliff

customer_reviews.title: 18 inch nonstick rolling pin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter and she can't wait to use it. It looks perfect for her needs she said, including hitting her husband over the head with it once in a while! (just kidding of course).
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L. Beratta

customer_reviews.title: Big Difference vs Wooden Rollers!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a wooden roller for some time. Oh my gosh what a difference this makes! No more dough sticking to the roller, good luck cleaning the wooden ones too, but this one is a breeze. It makes both rolling and cleaning SOOOO much easier. I'm definitely sold on these.
customer_reviews.author: MovieGuyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Does Just What it Says it Does
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't stick, even when rolling out yeast bread dough for rolls, etc. It is a snap to clean also. When they go back on sale, I will be buying one for each of my daughters.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: I am replacing my old roller because I loved it, but I will not immerse it this ...
customer_reviews.text: The comment about the inside is spot on. I am replacing my old roller because I loved it, but I will not immerse it this time. At the end it was dripping nasty black rust into my cookies...
customer_reviews.author: Angella L.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible for Rolling Out Sugar Cookie Dough
customer_reviews.text: This rolling pin is NOT non-stick. In fact, it's the opposite. I make a lot of sugar cookie cut outs and the amount of dough that sticks to this pin is crazy! I find myself flouring this pin constantly! Do yourself a favor and get a nice, solid maple wood rolling pin.
customer_reviews.author: Figgy

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a basic, non-stick rolling pin. Item is easy to clean and most doughs do not stick to it. I also use this for fondant and have good success.
customer_reviews.author: Katie H.

customer_reviews.title: Sticky rolling pin
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because it was on sale and it said "nonstick" which is very important when working with dough. However, all it does is stick! I didn't like it at all and even though it was cheap I'm thinking about returning it ....
customer_reviews.author: pickyshopper

product_meta.title: Sunbeam Nonstick Rolling Pin - 18 inches Long - 10 inch Rolling Area
product_meta.description: Sunbeam offers you this 18" Non-stick Rolling pin, great for rolling out your pie crust for that perfect pie ro making candy, no more sticking to the roller with this non-stick surface. Make the perfect pizza crust without your dough sticking. This wide rolling pin is great for making a challenging rolling job an easy one. If you like to bake and don't want to deal with the hasle of having things stick to your roller then switch to our Non-stick rolling pin for your baking needs.
feature_bullets: 18 inches long with 10 inches of rolling area
Ideal for use in the home or school kitchen

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars24 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
